Read the following metrical description of the poem and then sort the six statements in the unsorted box below into the ‘true’ and ‘false’ categories.

“The poem is written in elegiac couplets, a form which alternates dactylic lines in hexameter and pentameter. (Dactyls are metrical ‘feet’ where a long syllable is followed by two shorter syllables.) The shifting weight and emphasis within and between lines lends itself to satire as well as to poignancy.”
three characteristic belong in each category.
